name: Sika Sarnafil
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check Substrate Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Attach Photo
Prepare Substrate. (moisture test if required) prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris.
Attach Photo
Apply Sarnacol. Record atmospheric & substrate conditions & notate in QA Documents. Humidity <85%, Delta >3⁰, Air Temp 5-40⁰.
Attach Photo
Apply Sarnafil. Overlap as per manufacturers instructions,75mm, stagger cut joins where possible, detail strip to be installed at cut joins.
Attach Photo
Weld all joins, Ensure PPE, Respirator, fire extinguisher within vicinity. Weld overlap in one direction to avoid ribbons --Ensure 75mm overlap
Attach Photo

Install Pressure Bar, Install as instructed by builder to finish termination height. Install sealant is placed above pressure bar. Every second hole on pressure bar to be drilled. 1 hole overlap on edge of termination bar
Attach Photo
Check all welds with spatula/screwdriver for lifts. Use blunt pointed object to ensure all welds correctly sealed. Any lifts, circle to return to weld
Attach Photo
First signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any potential defects. Sign-off from builder.
Inspection of welds. All Elements to be inspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, lifts, burns, joins, and pressure seal
Test Welds. All Elements to be reinspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, pile heads. ensure all action items from previous inspection have been resolved.
Attach Photo
Final signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF

Enviro 700X + 800TC
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)
Attach Photo

Substrate Preparation and Caulking. Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris. Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projections. Apply a suitable and approved joint sealant such as Enviro Flex Pro or Enviro Flex FC to all joints and connecting building parts prior to the application of Enviro 700X.
Attach Photo
Priming. Apply primer (Enviro Epoxy B-LV / Enviro Prime P2 / Enviro Shield) using a brush or roller. Allow primer to fully cure before proceeding with the application of Enviro 700X.
Attach Photo

Mixing and Application. Enviro 700X should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT. (2 coats).
Attach Photo
Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged.

Top Coat. Enviro 800 TC should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical mixer at low speed prior to application.Add Part B to Part A and mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes. Allow to react for 10 minutes before application. Allow to react for 15 minutes when thinning with Enviro Thinner No.8 before application. Do not apply in damp or wet conditions. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat.
Attach Photo
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test.
Attach Photo
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF

Enviro Epoxy RC
Batch Number
Record batch number: Enviro Epoxy RC & Epoxy BL/V Primer

Confirm and ensure that the substrate complies with relevant substrate standards as per manufacturer data sheets and recommendations. Ensure that the substrate is structurally sound against movement and excessive deflection. Ensure that the surface to be repaired and/or coated is clean, and free from dust, dirt, oils or grease and have no projections of sharp protrusions.
Attach Photo

Ensure that all surfaces have been prepared by diamond grinding as necessary to a minimum 75 micron profile. Surface is to be clean and free of all debris. Make good any cracks with Enviro Epoxy B L/V. Any Large voids in the substrate should be filled with Envirosystems ExpoxyTuff HD Mortar and finished flush with the existing surface.
Attach Photo
For priming of trafficable hardstand areas apply 1 coat of Enviro Epoxy B L/V to concrete allowing overnight cure between coats. Do not apply where rain or low temperatures are likely.
Attach Photo
Sand plus Epoxy B according to the works' design specifications, to the uniformity needed to create a cove.
Attach Photo
Membrane Application (1st coat) - Mix and Apply Enviro Epoxy RC high solids epoxy coating by roller at @ 6m2 / L over the prepared surface in to coats to a minimum dry film thickness of 250 um.
Attach Photo
Membrane Application (2nd coat) - Mix and Apply EnviroEnviro Epoxy RC high solids epoxy coating by roller at @ 6m2 / L over the prepared surface in to coats to a minimum dry film thickness of 250 um.
Attach Photo
Curing - Allow to cure in accordance with Manufacturers Specifications
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequate cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF

Enviro AHS Injectable Hose System
BATCH DETAIL NUMBER OF PRODUCTS
Enviro Hydrotite
PRE COMMENCEMENT CHECKLIST
MATERIAL MANAGEMENT AND STORAGE
Material to be stored in a dry, clean place and directly out of sunlight.
ACCEPTANCE OF SUBSTRATE
Obtain Clearance for work to commence.
The Substrate shall be smooth, without protrusions, voids or formwork distortions.
Clean Substrate so that it is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion.
APPLICATION
INSTALLATION OF HYDROTITE
Rectify Existing Sheet Membrane. Ensure overlap and correct bonding to existing sheets.
Hose/Injection. Installation of Enviro AHS / Sika Fuko Hose in accordance with Technical Data Sheets. Ensure all hose endings are located at the top corner of the openings and secured.
DETAILING
Vertical / Horizontal Waterstop
Installation of Enviro Hydrotite within the body of the Infill Opening
Installation of Enviro Leakmaster above the Enviro Hydrotite (adjacent) within the body of the Infill Opening.
TESTING
QA TESTING
Inspect after installation of reinforcement/finishes to check for any damage to waterproofing and rectify as required.
Check all welds with spatula/screwdriver or blutn instrument to ensure all welds are correctly sealed. Any lifts, circle to return to weld to the sheet membrane.
Final Builders Sign off.
Builders final sign off.
Envirosystems 200P - Internal Wet Areas
Batch Number
Record batch number Min 1 photo
Floor Substrate

Surfaces must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, or any foreign matter. All loose particles including dust, laitance, grease and other contaminants such as spray paint, coatings and curing compounds and the like should be removed by grinding or similar. Steel surfaces should be treated with appropriate degreasers, then grit blasted and/or wire brushed where necessary. Cracks bigger than 1mm to be reffered to engineers for treatment methodolgy. Min 2 photos
Puddle Flanges
PVC Puddle flanges to be recessed into substrate so that they finish flush with the substrate. Min 2 photos
Wall Substrate

FC sheeting to be installed to manufacturers specifications (i.e. maximum 6mm gap at floor / wall junctions) FC sheet and nails to be set with manufacturers base coat. Masonry substrates must be rendered /skimmed. Min 2 photos
SFL

Falls in the substrate to drains to prevent ponding water outside of shower (1:100). Falls in the substrate to drains to prevent ponding water inside of shower (1:80). Falls in the substrate to drains to prevent ponding water in a bathroom designed as an unenclosed shower (1:80).
Holdpoint
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Moisture Content-Tramex Moisture Reader
Enviro Shield -Max 6.9% Enviro Prime WB - Max 4.5% Record and mark reading on tested area ( min 3 tests ) 3 photo of Markings on tested area and Tramex reading.
Primer Application

Add Enviro Shield Part B (grey liquid hardener) to the Enviro Shield Part A (base). Mix using slow speed (max 400 rpm) mechanical mixing equipment with a suitable paste type mixing paddle attached. Mix for 5 minutes or until uniform. Allow to stand 5 minutes after mixing and then mix again for a minute. Apply 1 coat of Enviro Shield between temperatures of 5-35C with a brush and roller. Visually check product is cured before proceeding to the next step. Same applies for Enviro Prime WB above. Min 2 photos of primer applied. Min 1 photo of temperature reading prior to application.
Fillet and Bondbreaker

Surfaces must be clean and dry. Apply the sealant firmly into the internal corner or joint and tool to the required cove size as per the relevant Australian Standard. This is to be a 12mm x 12mm coved fillet as per AS3740 class III membrane requirements for internal. Allow to be track free before proceeding with membrane application. Visually check product is cured before proceeding to the next step. Min 2 photos. Min 1 photo with coving testing tool.
Wall Membrane Application

Enviro 200P Ultra can be applied using a brush or roller in temperatures of 5-35C. Apply Enviro 200P Ultra to achieve the minimum Dry Film Thickness (DFT) of 0.6mm. Prefabricated waterproof collars to be installed and incorporated into waterproofing membrane around all plumbing penetrations. Visually check product is cured before proceeding to the next step. Min 2 Photos Min 1 photo of temperature reading
Floor Membrane 1st Coat

Mix using slow speed (max 400 rpm) mechanical mixing equipment with a suitable paste type mixing paddle attached. Enviro 200P Ultra can be applied using a brush or roller in temperatures of 5-35C. Apply Enviro 200P Ultra to achieve the minimum Dry Film Thickness (DFT) of 0.5mm. Visually check product is cured before proceeding to the next step. Min 2 photos Min 1 photo of temperature reading
Floor Membrane 2nd Coat

Mix using slow speed (max 400 rpm) mechanical mixing equipment with a suitable paste type mixing paddle attached. Enviro 200P Ultra can be applied using a brush (Min 150mm upturns) or roller in temperatures between 5-35C. Apply Enviro 200P Ultra to achieve the minimum Dry Film Thickness (DFT) of 0.5mm. Visually check product is cured before proceeding to the next step. Min 2 photos Min 1 photo of temperature reading
QA Testing

Thickness testing of application to the recommended DFT to manufacturers instructions( 0.6mm walls 1.0mm floors 3 tests on floor/ 3 tests on walls.) 24 hour Flood testing. 6 photo of markings of testing on susbtrate and Positector reading Min 1 photo of Flood testing
Holdpoint

SikaRoof® MTC-12 UV (SIKA Sikalastic 100 EP + 488 +622)
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check Substrate Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Attach Photo
Prepare Substrate. (moisture test if required) prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris.
Attach Photo

PRIMER: 2:1 mix ratio (Part A: Part B) mixed for a minimum of 2 minutes - Prior the application of SikaRoof® MTC-12 UV the priming coat if used must have cured tack-free.. For the Waiting Time / Overcoating please refer to the PDS of the appropriate primer. Damageable areas (handrails etc.) have to be protected with tape or plastic wrapping. Please note, always begin with details prior to the installation of the horizontal surface
Attach Photo
1. Apply first coat of Sikalastic®-488. Please refer to the Sikalastic®-488 product data sheet for application rates and drying times; 2 coats will be required to achieve the DFT of 1.2mm
Attach Photo

2. Apply the top coat of Sikalastic®-622 Excel Top PLUS. If a non-slip finish is required, two coats will need be installed with the non-slip finish being broadcast into the first coat of Sikalastic®-622 Excel Top PLUS. Once first coat is cured, the coating should be broomed/vacuumed of excess material and the subsequent top coat applied within 24 hours.
Attach Photo
First signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any potential defects. Sign-off from builder.
Inspection of welds. All Elements to be inspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, lifts, burns, joins, and pressure seal
Test Welds. All Elements to be reinspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, pile heads. ensure all action items from previous inspection have been resolved.
Attach Photo
Final signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Sign-off from builder and hand-over

Item no. 4 Floor grinding to prepare surface to be membraned / coated
Hazard and Risk : Manual handling injuries. Contact with faulty electrical equipment. Running over obstacles and debris.
Prior to using tools, ensure Polyseal risk assessment is completed with FM for the use of electrical leads and non battery tools. Ensure that person operating the machinery is suitably qualified.
Ensure permits for floor grinding are obtained and current for duration of the work.
Ensure a p2 filter mask is worn during the grinding works to prevent inhalation of silica dust
Ensure vacuum extraction with HEPA filter is in use and all fittings are adequate
Check leads and connections daily.
Set up exclusion zones where work is to be undertaken.
Ensure Polyseal provides provisions (e.g. tape off area) to prevent access from any other trades.
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE: masks, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts, pants and ear protection.
Ensure hand grinder is currently tagged and frequently inspected & service monthly / serviced by licensed electrician. Check leads and connections daily.
Ensure experienced operators use the machines as per personnel competency & training.
Dust to be placed in plastic bags and secured and placed in bins provided.

Set-up barricades and/or signage where and if required.

Enviro HP1200 + 700X
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)
Attach Photo

Substrate Preparation and Caulking. Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris. Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projections. Apply a suitable and approved joint sealant such as Enviro Flex Pro or Enviro Flex FC to all joints and connecting building parts prior to the application of Enviro 700X
Attach Photo
Priming. Apply primer (Enviro Epoxy B-LV / Enviro Prime P2 / Enviro Shield) using a brush or roller. Allow primer to fully cure before proceeding with the application of Enviro 700X
Attach Photo

Mixing and Application. HP1200 should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT. (2 coats)
Attach Photo
Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged

Top Coat. Enviro 700X should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical mixer at low speed prior to application.Add Part B to Part A and mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes. Allow to react for 10 minutes before application. Allow to react for 15 minutes when thinning with Enviro Thinner No.8 before application. Do not apply in damp or wet conditions. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat
Attach Photo
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test
Attach Photo
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over

BluSeal PVC Liner
Batch Detail Number of Products
BluSeal PVC Liner
Pre Commencement Checklist
Material Management & Storage
Material to be stored in a dry, clean place and directly out of sunlight.
Acceptance of Substrate

Obtain Clearance for work to commence. The Substrate shall be smooth, without protrusions, voids or formwork distortions. Clean Substrate so that it is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion.
Membrane Application of System
Installation of PVC Liner
Overlap as per manufacturers instructions,75mm, stagger cut joins where possible, detail strip to be installed at end of PVC requiring termination into substrate.
Weld all joints and install pressure seals as required in accordance with PDS.
Abut Threaded Rods or anchors / fixings into PVC Liner with circular weld patch to base of anchor locations.
Detailing
Vertical & Horizontal Termination

Ensure Vertical terminations of membrane on a building elemnt are provided with a pressure seal, reglet or by being overcoated with a waterproof or water resistant material to protect the membrane edge.
Testing
QA Testing

Inspect after installation of reinforcement/finishes to check for any damage to waterproofing and rectify as required. Check all welds with spatula/screwdriver or blutn instrument to ensure all welds are correctly sealed. Any lifts, circle to return to weld.
Final Builders Sign off.
Builders final sign off.
Enviro 700X + 250NS
Specification / Standard Manufacturer's Technical Data Sheet / AS4654.1 - 2012
Batch Number
Record batch number
Substrate crack and falls inspection

Obtain clearance for work to commence. Clean substrate so that is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles, and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion. for non metal surfaces: ICRI CSP-4 to CSP-6 for metal surfaces: ICRI CSP-1 to CSP-2.
Substrate crack and falls inspection

Fill cracks less than 1.6mm with filler compatible (Enviro-Flex Pro) with the membrane system.Live cracks to be referred to engineers for treatment methodology. Builder to approve falls on substrate(Min 1:100) prior to application of membrane.
Moisture Content
Note. min. 3 tests per 15m2 Enviro Epoxy B-LV up to 6.9% Enviro Prime P2 up to 5%
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Ambient temperature and RH
Reading twice a day- every 4 hours Mirvac to confirm temperature between the ranges of 5-35 degrees celsius prior to application of membrane. RH must be greater than 50%
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Mechanical Mixing
If applying Enviro Epoxy B-LV: Mix Part B, liquid hardener, to the Enviro Epoxy B-LV Part A base. Thoroughly mix with a mechanical mixer at low speed for not less than 5 minutes and until uniform.
Applying primer

Using a brush or roller apply the chosen primer. Allow to cure prior to over coating with sealants and/or membrane coats."Primer should be dry to touch and not be tacky when applying pressure to it. Enviro-Epoxy B-LV will take around 16-48 hrs @ 25 degrees C to dry (but could be longer depending on ambient temp and RH)
Seal/apply bondbreaker at junctions hob/floor
Apply Enviro Flex Pro to form smooth 15mm flexible cove to all internal corners, penetrations and joints.
Application of Enviro-700X

Mix Bucket at low speed( 400RPM) until thoroughly mixed. Apply two coats of 700X. Where membrane is terminated on a building element: Ensure that the termination height of the membrane above the FFL and/or invert level of a correctly placed overflow/spitter satisfies the Façade engineer's advice
QA Testing

Inspect after installation of reinforcement/finishes to check for any damage to waterproofing and rectify as required. Thickness testing of application to the recommended DFT of 1.5mm to manufacturers instructions. 5 tests per 15m2 Holiday/ spark testing of area.
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Application of 250N-S Top Coat

Mix Bucket at low speed( 400RPM) until thoroughly mixed. Apply 1 coats of 250N-S Where membrane is terminated on a building element: Ensure that the termination height of the membrane above the FFL and/or invert level of a correctly placed overflow/spitter satisfies the Façade engineer's advice
Protection of membrane edge

Ensure vertical terminations of membranes on a building element are provided with a pressure seal, reglet or by being overcoated with a waterproof or water resistant material to protect the membrane edge. Ensure vertical membrane termination junctions are caulked with Enviro FC pro.
Completion of Work Element
Delivery Checklist
Check correct materials are received at least 24 hours prior to commencing work on site
Batch No.
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Attach Delivery Docket
Pre-Inspection Checklist
General Area
Has the builder provided a marked up plan on each area to be waterproofed?
Marked up plan has to be numbered if more than one area at a time is to be completed
Has the concrete been cured for 28 days, date of pour to be provided?
Has concrete moisture test been carried out and the result was provided for the locations on a marked up plan?
The moisture level should be around 7%
Is the concrete finished to an acceptable steel trowel class finish?
Have all tape, steel wire, nails, plywood or formwork, bracing, dyna bolt and/or steel brackets been removed and patched?
Is there any cracking in the substrate? If yes, an engineer’s report will need to be provided or the builder must sign off prior to commencement of works
Has any chemicals been used in the concrete process that may affect the membrane adhesion?
